description: A probable Romano-British shrine which survived as an earthen mound, excavated in 1954 and 2013. Excavations revealed a floor surface, wall foundations of an enclosure, and 225 coins that provide a broad 3rd - 4th CE date.
bibliography: Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Upper Holt Copse, Teffont (Wiltshire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
Roberts. “Unpublished. Draft Interim Specialist Reports Consulted for Recent Excavations,” 2014.
